abracagan_introduction_to_the_almost_mag.description:
Requires: entry-level Python and TensorFlow knowledge

Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs for brevity) are one of the hottest topics in the Deep Learning world.

After briefly introducing the core theory behind this family of models, we will go over some significant milestones and real-world applications. Having a better understanding of what a GAN is and how it can solve real-world problems, the talk will cover how to code one using Python + TensorFlow and the few steps required to deliver it quickly to production using Google Cloud ML Engine.

The Talk will feature slides, materials under the form of Jupyter Notebooks on Colab will be made available before the session.
abracagan_introduction_to_the_almost_mag.title: AbracaGAN: Introduction to the almost magical world of GANs

android_jetpack_easy_navigation_with_the.description: Nel corso degli anni implementare la navigazione in app è sempre stato un incubo per gli sviluppatori Android. La risposta di Google a questo problema è Android Jetpack: un set di librerie per semplificare e accelerare lo sviluppo, creando app con basi solide e di alta qualità. Fra queste librerie vi è la Navigation, una libreria che semplifica sensibilmente l’implementazione della navigazione in una app Android, mettendoci a disposizione tool grafici e API che ci permettono di semplificare il codice, rendendolo più pulito e leggibile. In questa sessione parleremo di come usare il Navigation Editor in Android Studio, tramite XML o tramite le API Kotlin (o Java) per definire il navigation graph, e come tutto questo semplifica la navigazione nella tua app, e come gestire i deep link tramite la Navigation.
android_jetpack_easy_navigation_with_the.title: Android JetPack: Easy navigation with the new Navigation Controller

arcore_is_magic.description: ARCore is the Google library that allows to build new augmented reality experiences that seamlessly blend the digital and physical worlds. We will see all the features supported by ARCore through the development of a "Magic" App
arcore_is_magic.title: ARCore is Magic

behind_the_curtains_how_photos_works.description: Google Photos is an amazing piece of software, and API are pretty amazing. The only problem? They are not available on Android just yet. Join us to learn how we bypassed this limitation to create a selfie box based on Kotlin, Things™, and, of course, Google Photos!
behind_the_curtains_how_photos_works.title: Behind the curtains: how Photos™ works

beyond_smart_speakers_get_your_google_as.description: In an ever-expanding world of devices for the Google Assistant (smart speaker, smartphone, tablet, smartwatch, earphones, smart TV, car, smart display, and the list goes on and on), developers face today completely new challenges in creating effective and consistent experiences for users. In this talk, we’ll take a closer look at our user’s daily journey as they’re moving from one device to another and cover some key considerations for designing Actions on Google across surfaces - with useful tips to understand when and how to leverage visuals alongside voice interactions, to create rich, delightful conversational experiences for smart displays and more.
beyond_smart_speakers_get_your_google_as.title: Beyond Smart Speakers: Get Your Google Assistant Apps Ready for Smart Displays

closing.description: Closing is a great time to have some fun and meet new people
closing.title: Closing

come_gestire_una_campagna_pubblicitaria_.title: Come gestire una campagna pubblicitaria con AdWords - guida di sopravvivenza

creating_ml-powered_applications.description:
Each day we are hearing yet another application that announces a new cool feature powered by machine learning. It’s pretty exciting but when the time comes to deep diving into machine learning, it can be intimidating, especially if you don’t have machine learning background.  

In this session, you will get the gist of newly announced MLKit & Tensorflow Lite. We'll be learning about MLKit features and creating custom Tensorflow model and using it in app via MLKit
creating_ml-powered_applications.title: Creating ML-powered applications

designing_for_wicked_challenges.description:
This workshop is based on the Lab Exercises I had the opportunity to facilitate with Dave Houge UX Lead, Android @Google and it is a really interesting workshop for developers/designers/product managers addressing challenges and interacting with users!
Throughout 3 Lab exercises we will intro "wicked problems", what are they, how to address them and how to "try" to solve them without creating others! That's wicked!
At each Lab Exercise attendees will do some hands-on design/sketching, discussion and ideation. Each Lab Exercise builds upon the information and exercises that preceded it. The third and final lab exercise is more opened-ended (and more wicked), because the attendees will have already been walked through the other exercises.
designing_for_wicked_challenges.title: Designing for wicked challenges

develop_a_product_on_gcp.description: How to develop a scalable and multi tenant product on GCP from scratch using some of the services provided by Google.
develop_a_product_on_gcp.title: Develop a product on GCP

digital_records_evidence_-_oracles_and_t.description:
Blockchain is like sex and teenagers: everyone talks about it but no one address it correctly.
One of the main issues is the trust and authenticity of the digital records that we write and read from the DLT.
Oracles are definitely one the solutions in the scene, let's see how they works and what they guarantee.
digital_records_evidence_-_oracles_and_t.title: Digital records evidence - Oracles and the Bitcoin blockchain

firebase_cloud_firestore_deep_dive.description: Firebase offers two cloud-based, client-accessible database solutions that support realtime data syncing. In this workshop, we’ll focus on Could Firestore, Firebase's new database solution. Cloud Firestore is an efficient, low-latency database solution for mobile apps that is optimized for speed, security, and offline use. As part of this workshop, we’ll build an app using Cloud Firestore focusing on realtime updates, expressive querying, and offline support. The workshop participants will learn how to read and write data to Firestore from an Android app, listen to changes in Firestore data in realtime, use Firebase Authentication and security rules to secure Firestore data, and write complex Firestore queries.
firebase_cloud_firestore_deep_dive.title: Firebase Cloud Firestore: Deep Dive

guida_intergalattica_per_cercatori_di_la.description: Come strutturare un buon CV tips & tricks. Come fare un buon colloquio, utilizzare i social al fine di trovare un impiego e gestire la propria reputation online.
guida_intergalattica_per_cercatori_di_la.title: Guida intergalattica per cercatori di lavoro

how_to_become_an_android_dev_starting_fr.description: Starting from my working experience I want to describe the similarities between Android and iOS platforms, demonstrating that these worlds are not so far!
how_to_become_an_android_dev_starting_fr.title: How to become an Android dev starting from iOS (and vice versa)

il_lato_oscuro_del_deep_learning.description: Tutti hanno sentito parlare almeno una volta del potere magico del machine learning. Quanti conoscono però il “lato oscuro” delle tecnologie data-driven, come bias negli algoritmi, violazione della privacy, e minacce alla sicurezza? Attenzione ad affidarsi ciecamente al “deep learning”, a meno di non essere in cerca di “deep trouble”.
il_lato_oscuro_del_deep_learning.title: Il lato oscuro del Deep Learning

image_recognition_with_tensorflow_using_.description:
Nowadays, Deep Learning is widely used in every IT sector even though a lot people might not know this. The expression “Deep Learning” brings together a vast series of algorithms which are based on the concept of the neural networks. 
Today, image recognition provided by neural networks and trained via Deep Learning is, in certain circumstances, better than humans’ recognition. 
For instance, voice and image recognition provided by Google, relies on Deep Learning. What we buy or watch on Amazon and/or Netflix is generated by artificial neural networks calibrated on the basis of our taste. So, how does this work?
In this speech we are going to understand the basic principle of Deep Learning and how it could be performed with Tensorflow during the image recognition process.
image_recognition_with_tensorflow_using_.title: Image Recognition with TensorFlow using Deep Learning

introducing_workmanager.description:
Background processing is an integral part of Android development, and the WorkManager API is the architecture component to manage your Android background jobs.

New battery optimizations are key to improving the user experience, but these bring new challenges for the developers implementing background jobs:
* API Level 23 introduced Doze Mode and App Standby
* API Level 24 limited implicit Broadcasts and introduced doze-on-the-go
* API Level 26 further limited background behavior

WorkManager supports a combination of opportunistic and guaranteed execution. 

In this talk you’ll learn what WorkManager is and how you can use it to:
* Schedule a simple task
* Chain tasks
* Display task status in the UI
* Cancel tasks 

WorkManager API is part of Android Jetpack’s Architecture Component, and is currently in alpha.
introducing_workmanager.title: Introducing WorkManager

introduction_to_sceneform.description: This codelab will guide you step by step to create an "AR Stickers" type application using ARCore. This application shows a gallery of objects that can be placed, or anchored in the augmented world. Then take a photo of the AR scene and save it to Photos.
introduction_to_sceneform.title: Introduction to SceneForm

la_morte_nera_e_se_fosse_prototipizzata_.description: Vedremo come sfruttare al meglio Firebase e React per prototipazione veloce di applicazioni complesse. Sfruttando le nuove feature di Firebase in un contesto a componenti impareremo come accelerare senza perder pezzi per strada.
la_morte_nera_e_se_fosse_prototipizzata_.title: La Morte Nera, e se fosse prototipizzata con Firebase e React?

library_development_open_source_your_ide.description:
Have you ever thought that your idea could help other developers? Join the magic world of open source! 
In this talk we are going to share some tips and the secrets to become an open source master. Of course some practical examples based on our experience cannot miss.
library_development_open_source_your_ide.title: Library development: open source your ideas!

ml_kit_for_mobile_developers.description: ML Kit is a mobile SDK that brings Google's machine learning expertise to Android and iOS apps in a powerful yet easy-to-use package.  During this talk, we are going to learn how we can boost out firebase app with a live demo that uses image recognition.
ml_kit_for_mobile_developers.title: ML Kit for Mobile Developers

motion_layout_easy_animations_for_everyo.description:
Vi è mai capitato di esservi ritrovati a scrivere valanghe di righe di codice nelle vostre view per realizzare semplici animazioni?
Se la risposta è sí, allora questo è il Talk che fa per voi! La versione 2.0 in arrivo per il ConstraintLayout introduce il potentissimo MotionLayout!
Scopriamo insieme le potenzialità del MotionLayout tramite esempi e rimaniamo insieme stupiti dalla sua semplicità!
motion_layout_easy_animations_for_everyo.title: Motion Layout: easy animations for everyone!

next_generation_web_assets.description: How the next generation web assets (AMP, PWA, Speed, UX) can have an impact on your mobile website KPI and on your revenue
next_generation_web_assets.title: Next generation web assets

opening.description: Official start of the conference. Greetings from the organizers, sponsors and partners.
opening.title: GDG Milano 2018 - Opening keynote

registration.description: Get your badge, coffee, enjoy talking with tech edicts around
registration.title: Registration

solid_principles_in_practice_the_clean_a.description:
La clean architecture è stata formalizzata in un post da Robert C. Martini nel 2012, è abbastanza nuova anche se si basa sui principi SOLID (presentati per la prima volta nei primi anni 2000).
Il beneficio principale che si ottiene usando questa architettura è la testabilità del codice, infatti impone una separazione netta fra il codice core dell'applicazione e quello relativo ai fattori esterni (che di solito complicano il testing).
In questo talk vedremo un esempio pratico in Kotlin di come sfruttare i principi alla base della clean architecture. Una particolare attenzione sarà tenuta per la D di SOLID: la dependency inversion.
solid_principles_in_practice_the_clean_a.title: SOLID principles in practice: the clean architecture

the_build_time_of_my_life.description: Building an Android app can be an extremely frustrating experience for developers. Despite caching and all the new features in the Android build system, sometimes even the smallest change can cause a new build to take minutes. In this talk we will explore ways to improve your build times in a modern project that uses Kotlin, annotation processing and multiple modules.
the_build_time_of_my_life.title: The (build) time of my life

the_power_of_kotlin_annotations.description:
The main topics of this session are:
- What an annotation is
- How to apply it
- How to create a custom annotation
- How to create an annotation processor
the_power_of_kotlin_annotations.title: The power of Kotlin @Annotations

want_a_slice.description: With the announcement of Android Slices, you can now provide rich, dynamic and interactive content to your users even outside your app! Slices allow you to build content to be displayed in the Google Search app and later in other places like the Google Assistant. Slices can help users perform tasks faster by enabling engagement outside of the fullscreen app experience. In this session, we’ll explore how Slices can help you provide a better experience for your users and see how it’s implemented.
want_a_slice.title: Want a Slice?

alessandro_aglietti.bio: Alessandro Aglietti, from Firenze, is aqquadro: since 2004 face-to-face to a monitor. Not to write poems! Be RSS: ban social network from life for life.
alessandro_aglietti.name: Alessandro Aglietti
alessandro_aglietti.title: Developer

andrea_maglie.bio: Andrea Maglie is a Senior Developer specialized in Java and, more recently, in Kotlin. He currently works on Musement's Android app and Google Assistant app.
andrea_maglie.name: Andrea Maglie
andrea_maglie.shortBio: Senior Developer specialized in Java and, more recently, in Kotlin
andrea_maglie.title: Senior Developer

aygul_zagidullina.bio: Dr. Aygul Zagidullina is a passionate Actions on Google developer. Her work experience includes Google, Todoist, MotaWord. She holds a PhD in quantum chemistry and prior to Google dedicated 6 years to scientific research at the University of Stuttgart. Aygul is a very active member of the London digital ecosystem and has been involved in many innovative projects. She is a Google Developer Group (GDG)/ Women Techmakers (WTM) London lead, Google Top Contributor (TC)/ Trusted Tester (TT), and UK STEM Ambassador. Aygul has been a distinguished speaker at numerous international industry events in the US (at Google HQ), UK, Germany, Ireland, UAE, Greece, Turkey, Poland, Georgia, and Russia. She was named as one of The NEXT 100 Top Influencers of the European Digital Industry in 2013.
aygul_zagidullina.name: Aygul Zagidullina
aygul_zagidullina.shortBio: GDE for Assistant, WTM and GDG Lead, Google Launchpad Mentor, UK STEM Ambassador
aygul_zagidullina.title: Actions on Google Developer, GDG/WTM London Lead

boris_damato.bio: Boris is an Android Developer working at ClearScore. He likes participating at tech conferences, giving talks, sharing knowledge and learning new things, but above all, he loves making beautiful and performant apps. He loves learning new languages, architectural patterns and building meaningful animations.
boris_damato.name: Boris D'Amato
boris_damato.title: Android Developer @ ClearScore - GDG Bari co-organizer

busra_deniz_akn.bio:
Buşra Deniz Akin is a Software Engineer who has a keen interest in developing high-quality mobile applications. Currently, she’s working for The App Business. 

Besides being co-organizer in two different communities, Google Developer Group and WomenTechMakers London, she enjoys voluntarily organising and speaking at developer events.  She believes in sharing knowledge and collaborating with the other people through these events, will come hand in hand with innovation and new perspectives.
busra_deniz_akn.name: Buşra Deniz Akın
busra_deniz_akn.shortBio: Android Dev @TAB, GDGLondon and WTMLondon Lead
busra_deniz_akn.title: Android Dev @TAB, Lead @GDGLondon & @WTMLondon

elia_rigo.bio: I was born in 1994. I’ve always been interested in IT since I was a child. I’m currently a student at the University of Trento attending a Master in Computer Sciences. Simultaneously, in 2011, I set up my own startup and from 2017 I collaborate with the Bruno Kessler Foundation in the Embedded System division.

elia_rigo.shortBio: Always been interested in IT since I was a child. I’m currently a student at the University of Trento attending a Master in Computer Sciences

emiliano_de_matteis.bio: While at Google, I've covered three roles. I've started as App Promotion Specialist, then I moved to Mobile UX Specialist and now I'm Mobile Web Lead for Italy. Previously I was Account Manager at Twitter for almost 3 years, dealing with Mobile and Performance Clients. Before moving to Ireland for Twitter, I was working as Demand Generation and Social Media Specialist for Microsoft Italy and then as Digital Media Planner for Universal McCann Italy.

fabio_collini.bio:
Fabio Collini is a Google Developer Expert for Android, he started Android development in 2009, first as a freelance with two apps on Play Store and then as senior developer. Now he works as a remote developer in the Android team at the New York Times. He is one of the authors of the second edition of Android Programmazione Avanzata, an Italian book dedicated to some advanced aspects of Android development.
He is a co-owner and writer for the blog CodingJam dedicated to Java, Android and web development.
fabio_collini.name: Fabio Collini
fabio_collini.shortBio: Google Developer Expert for Android, he started Android development in 2009
fabio_collini.title: Android Engineer

I've been working in Revevol since 2016 and now I'm leading the development of a product which is deployed on GCP and which uses several GCP services.

kaan_mamikoglu.bio: Kaan is a mobile software engineer at MyDrive Solutions, a Generali company, in London, UK. As an active community builder, he has co-organized a lot of developer events in the UK and Turkey such as DevFests, Android Developer Days’, Android Study Jams, and has been a distinguished speaker at many international industry events in the US, UK, UAE, Turkey and Georgia. Besides being a Google Developer Group (GDG) London co-organizer, he is a Google Top Contributor (TC) and a Google Local Guide. Kaan is passionate about exploring new technologies and traveling around the world.

laura_morinigo.bio: Laura is a Google Developer Expert in Firebase, entrepreneur, and mentor. She has been involved in the tech industry for over 10 years, working with different technologies as a fullstack developer and getting involved with education projects teaching coding. She is one of the organizers of GDG Cloud London and Women Techmakers lead. Originally from Buenos Aires, Argentina, she has been a digital nomad for about one year, traveling around; doing talks, workshops and connecting with the local tech communities. While she was on the road she created with her co-founders DMode Labs: a software company that promotes diversity and remote working.

laura_morinigo.shortBio: Google Developer Expert in Firebase, entrepreneur, and mentor. She has been involved in the tech industry for over 10 years.

Android User since 2010, attualmente lavoro come Android Developer in IQUII, a Roma. Seguo tutto ciò che riguarda il mondo Google, in particolare Android e Assistant. Mi piace tutto ciò che riguarda il design e la UX. Ho una smodata passione per le architetture software e la pulizia del codice e nel tempo libero amo la fotografie, leggere, guardare Film/Serie TV o bere una birra in compagnia.

michelantonio_trizio.bio: Engineer & Entreprener. I took master degree in computer Engineering with thesis in Artificial Intelligence at Polytechnic University of Bari in 2007. I worked for several years in ICT companies in the south of Italy as developer. I attended the Mind The Bridge startup school in San Francisco in 2011. Back in Italy I started working on my own companies. I'm the founder of GDG Bari and he is the current community lead. Now, I'm the CTO of Wideverse, a spin-off of Polytechnic University of Bari that works on VR and AR technologies. I'm an Android developer.

michelantonio_trizio.shortBio: Engineer,Android developer & Entreprener,I took master degree in computer Engineering with thesis in Artificial Intelligence.

panayotis_tzinis.bio:
Panayotis (AKA Darth), is the Intelligence Tech Lead of the X Factory of Moonshot Lab. 
The X Factory is a tech tank based  on the planet of Mustafar, where crazy people, from scientists to artists, to developers to technologists, share their ideas in order to create moonshots! A moonshot is a radical solution, integrating breakthrough technology with native thinking. More than on projects we are exploring ambitions!
Panayotis is also a Google Dev Expert on Product Strategy and a certified Google Sprint Master

pietro_maggi.bio:
I have 15+ years of development experience from 8-bit MCU to HTML5 web apps, architecting solutions for mobile devices before it was trendy.
In the Android Developer Relations team my focus is to provide an awesome developer experience around Play technologies like Android Vitals and Android App Bundles.

I believe that the best way to understand how something works is to take it apart (and possibly put it back together at the end). My children share this belief, which results in a lot of broken toys in our house!
I like spending time with my family and climbing mountains.
pietro_maggi.name: Pietro Maggi
pietro_maggi.shortBio: In the Android Developer Relations team my focus is to provide an awesome developer experience around Play technologies.

roberto_orgiu.bio:
Born in Italy in 1987, passionate for everything that switches on and off and particularly for handheld and wearable devices.
I love to learn new languages such as Kotlin, patterns and everything Android-related. I recently joined The New York Times Android team as Android Engineer.
roberto_orgiu.name: Roberto Orgiu
roberto_orgiu.shortBio: passionate for everything that switches on and off and particularly for handheld and wearable devices.

simone_scardapane.bio: I am a post-doc with a focus in machine learning and deep learning. I am very keen on promoting machine learning concepts and making them accessible to everyone by organizing events, speeches, and hackathons. I am the co-organizer of the Rome Machine Learning & Data Science Meetup, that organizes monthly events in Rome, and a member of the advisory board for Codemotion Italy. I am also a co-founder of the Italian Association for Machine Learning, a not-for-profit organization with the aim of promoting machine learning concepts in the public.

simone_scardapane.shortBio: Post-doc @ Sapienza | GDE for ML | IAML co-founder
